TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit MemoryResponseElement extends System.Web.Caching.ResponseElement

Docs.summary: Represents part of an output-cache entry that is stored in memory.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The output-cache response in a <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement> object is stored in memory as an array of bytes. The array can contain all or part of an output-cache response.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(unsigned int8[] buffer, int64 length) cil managed

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of `buffer` must not be `null`, although it can be a zero-length array.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Buffer As Byte()
public: property cli::array <System::Byte> ^ Buffer { cli::array <System::Byte> ^ get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets an array that contains all or part of an output-cache response.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement.Buffer%2A> property must not be `null`, although it can be a zero-length array. If <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement.Buffer%2A> property is `null`, the <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement> constructor throws an <xref:System.ArgumentNullException>. If the <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement.Length%2A> property is less than zero or greater than the size of the value of <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement.Buffer%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Length As Long
public: property long Length { long get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the size of the array that is referenced by the property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement> object that is created by ASP.NET is a fixed-size memory buffer that is created from a pool of memory buffers. As a result, the contents of a <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement> object often do not completely fill the <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement.Buffer%2A> array. Typically only a part of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement.Buffer%2A> array will contain response data. Therefore, providers that serialize the <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement.Buffer%2A> array directly (instead of serializing the complete type that is being stored in the output cache) must use the <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement.Length%2A> property to determine how much of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement.Buffer%2A> array must be stored.
